He doesn't need a buff.

He is incredibly oppresive in lane and is why he was not on free week for a very long time.

Not to mention riot just gave him a tiny little buff. I've never played yorick myself but he is very hard to kill,  and also does decent damage with his manamune, ghouls, and his ult that can change many teamfights ( ulting cassopedia, yasio, your ADC, and that jax... )

The sad thing is, we still see {{champion:64}} a lot even though he was oppressive. By now, with the health item nerfs, mana regen nerfs, and such, {{champion:83}} became more and more viable yet they never seemed to care...

The thing about Lee being oppressive is by him being able to gank as often as he can. Yorick is oppressive because you get a Tear and spam ghouls on people until they have to go back. All his ghouls, unlike Malz's voidspawn, automatically chase the nearest champion and will only hit a minion if a champ isn't near. His ghouls have one of the scariest AI's around and with the right amount of CDR, he can keep up his 20% damage reduc for the duration of his ult by keeping his ghouls up.

He's oppressively annoying and with Front Liners and Peelers being more popular, he'll likely make his return and be as irritating as he was back in S2.

But they die fast. Like, within 4 to 7 seconds, they will die. They do deal damage, but against ranged, his W is all he has, besides the E which is used as a heal.

Malz can keep his up for more than 20 seconds at a time, they even get stronger and gain more AS and health. 

They're both strong, but I can handle Yorick's minions, and I love Yorick, really. He's fun and he used to oppress but now he's just viable but barely played since he's not on Free Champion Week.

It may had been a dream or something but back about 2 or so years ago, I thought I saw him on the Free to Play.

They die fast because he can have so many all at once and he can spawn them rather quickly. A good Yorick is like a good Nasus. You get your max CDR and become a wall of huge damage and ungodly tankiness. 

His Q has a 5s CD base by max, his W has a 12s CD (His longest of his first three and the only ability that doesn't reduce in CD with level), and his E has a 6s CD. His R lasts for 10s. When you take into consideration that his ghouls last about 4ish seconds on average if not being AoE'd down, which usually means they have to save their AoE's for just his ghouls, he'll still sustain 2-3 ghouls in a team fight until his Revenant (Or the person the ghost is of) dies. 

Each ghoul also has 35% of his max health and 35% of his max AD. This means they do a lot of his damage and still manage to sustain a large amount of health while also taking 50% less from AoE abilities. 

Pretty much. Yorick is a Peeler and would definitely be considered an 'Avoid at all costs in a team fight' kinda champion.

This is the key mentality behind this. Riot is perfectly capable of making buff such as "Movement speed: 335 ->340" or "Scaling changed from .5 -> .55" until a character is in a spot where they are picked on par with the others. The issue with this is that it wouldn't address the innate flaws in his kit that Riot stated they are planning on changing. His kit is more binary than many of the newer champs, not good for someone who can be such an oppressive lane bully from quarter of a lane away.

I want to also emphasize my earlier use of the word "picked" because his winrate in hovering just below 50%, so it's more likely that some of his larger problems are mechanical problems rather than number problems.

They don't want him played often though, he isn't on the free week for a reason. His kit is toxic in the right hands (And by god I love being one of those right hands) and no one wants to see him often.

We could buff movement speed, maybe a small mana pool buff (honestly the most reasonable) but again putting him in a spotlight isn't a good idea, and will most likely just put him in Warwicks position where they overnerf him until they can properly fix him.

I first played yorick during that gamemode that everyone gave people supports for. Can't remember the name of it now. Didn't have a clue how to play him but realized he was something so I bought him and learned him. I am not a super great player but from my opinion he is not OP and not really underpowered either. 

In most of the games now you deal with super assassins that gap close and jump away, and every other non assassin champ that has mobility and range. They can shoot down the minions from distance, they can just jump away. With the low move speed he has trouble even trying to close with most popular champs despite the slow minion. the q speed boost does no good when he can't get in range to get a hit for the speed boost in the first place. But if you get a champ that doesn't have that range and mobility then he can do great. 

His biggest problem that I see is that he is designed for past seasons and is countered by too many new champs or old champs with mobility reworks. If his q granted the speed boost on activate, then I think that would put him in a decent spot vs newer champs. Maybe make his minions start hitting when they spawned instead of sitting there. The other downside is that he needs the tear first, giving other champs an earlier power boost, and that to spam the spells needed for the manamune upgrade, he just doesn't have enough mana to keep it up. So you get the choice between getting damage or mana early, with the former meaning that you take longer to get tear stacked up which is pretty much mandatory. That would be okay if he was powerful enough to take the hit to early game dominance that other champs get. But it's entirely situational on the enemy team how good he can be right now.

I think yorick would benefit greatly from an item that burrows from black cleaver and wits end. 

In that youd need a way to debuff the enemy's magic registance faster. Wits end takes too long to apply enough stacks to take advantage of the debuff with your w and e. Its also single target which is tough to consistantly apply wits end as yorick is easily kited. If he could debuff thei magic resist as well as say a riven with hydra and blsckcleaver can their armor resist then yorick would shine. To make it less op this debuff would have to apply only to him not allies. 
That way your w and e both apply 1 debuff penetrating and helping you heal. 

Or have an item that creates an aoe 400 radius similar to{{champion:75}}  spirit fire that would reduce the magic resist of enemies within the area. The reduction wouldn't stack with abssyal scepter to prevent it from being broken. 
It'd be a unique active with like a 16 second cool down. It wouldn't do any damage like spirit fire does only debuff. 

Item in question would likely be hybrid ap/ad leaning towards ad. Or be somewhat tanky. I could see it be built out of seekers armguard and pixaxe or something. Like a hybrid abyssal scepter but instead of aura its an aoe active.
